notes: All-electric CUV on E-GMP platform with 77.4 kWh battery (58 kWh on base). 800V architecture enables ultra-fast charging. High-voltage system requires EV-certified technicians. GT model features electronic limited-slip differential. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia EV6 article, January 2025 revision.

Large 3-row electric SUV on E-GMP platform with 99.8 kWh battery. 800V architecture with Vehicle-to-Load capability. High-voltage system requires specialized EV diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia EV9 article, January 2025 revision.

Built in Georgia on shared platform with Hyundai Palisade. Lambda II V6 engine with timing chain. Standard modern service requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Telluride article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation compact SUV. Hybrid and PHEV variants require high-voltage safety procedures. PHEV features 13.8 kWh battery. Timing chain on all engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Sportage article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation on N3 platform. Hybrid and PHEV variants require high-voltage safety procedures. PHEV features 13.8 kWh battery with 32-mile electric range. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Sorento article, January 2025 revision.
Replaces Sedona nameplate. Lambda II V6 with timing chain. Standard FWD minivan service requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Carnival article, January 2025 revision.
Replaces Optima nameplate. Built on N3 platform. Timing chain on all engines. GT model features AWD with 290 hp turbo engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia K5 article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation compact sedan. GT hatchback features performance-tuned suspension. Timing chain on all engines. Standard FWD service requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Forte article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation distinctive boxy CUV. Timing chain on all engines. Standard FWD service requirements. Turbo model features sport-tuned suspension. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Soul article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation eco-focused CUV. Hybrid and PHEV variants require high-voltage safety procedures. PHEV features 11.1 kWh battery. EV version has 64.8 kWh battery. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Niro article, January 2025 revision.
Subcompact SUV slotted below Sportage. Timing chain on all engines. Turbo AWD model features torque vectoring. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Seltos article, January 2025 revision.

RWD sport sedan with BMW-influenced chassis tuning. GT model features Brembo brakes and electronic limited-slip differential. Timing chain on all engines. Performance service requirements include premium fluids. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Stinger article, January 2025 revision.
Fourth generation subcompact. Timing chain engine. Basic FWD service requirements. Discontinued in North America after 2023. Data sourced from Wikipedia Kia Rio article, January 2025 revision.
